titles.title: Aircraft Equipment Settlement Leases Act of 1993
To provide for the treatment of certain aircraft equipment settlement leases.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR E458)
Referred to the House Committee on Judiciary.
Referred to the House Committee on Education and Labor.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Economic and Commercial Law.
Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Education and Labor

action.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Labor-Management Relations.
Reported by the Committee on Judiciary. H. Rept. 103-33, Part I.
Mr. Brooks moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Laid on the table. See S. 400 for further action.

bill.summary: 2/25/1993--Introduced. Aircraft Equipment Settlement Leases Act of 1993 - Treats certain pension liability settlement leases involving aircraft equipment (or vessels) as leases for purposes of the Federal bankruptcy code if any agreements settling such liability: (1) involve at least one party who was a debtor under the code; (2) were, are, or will be made with the Pension Benefit Guaranty Corporation under the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 (ERISA); and (3) stipulate that the leases shall be so treated.
